intro: Lepanthes reventador, commonly known as the Reventador orchid, is a species of orchid native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It is characterized by its delicate, often fragrant flowers that come in a variety of colors, including white, pink, and purple. The plant typically grows on tree trunks or branches, thriving in the humid, cool conditions of cloud forests. Its leaves are usually narrow and革质, adapted to conserve moisture in its native environment. Lepanthes reventador is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its ecological role in supporting diverse insect and bird life.
